title: Get all Buildings
description: This method returns all building objects.

examples.title: Curl
examples.content: curl -H "X-Authorization: <Your-API-Key>" --url https://databridge.sage.edu/v1/building/

examples.title: Ruby
examples.content:
# This code snippet uses an open-source library. http://unirest.io/ruby
response = Unirest.get "https://databridge.sage.edu/v1/building/",
headers:{ "X-Authorization" => "<Your-API-Key>", "Accept" => "application/json" }.to_json

examples.title: PHP
PowerShell
examples.content:
# PowerShell v3 and above
$headers = New-Object "System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary[[String],[String]]"
$headers.Add("X-Authorization", '<Your-API-Key>')
$result = Invoke-RestMethod -Uri https://databridge.sage.edu/v1/building/ -Headers $headers

examples.title: Java
examples.content:
# This code snippet uses an open-source library. http://unirest.io/java
HttpResponse <String> response = Unirest.get("https://databridge.sage.edu/v1/building/")
.header("X-Authorization", "<Your-API-Key>")
.header("Accept", "application/json")
.asString();

examples.title: Python
.NET

Success 200.description: Tells the application if the request was successful.
The objects that have been returned.
The numeric id of the object.
The numeric id of the corresponding campus.
The code assigned to the building by Informer.
The common name associated with the building.
The date and time that the object was created.
The date and time that the object was updated.

Error 4xx/5xx.description: Tells the application if the request was successful.
An error message from the server.

examples.title: Error: Not Privileged
Error: Invalid API Key
Error: Method not found
Error: Missing Header Option

name: GetBuildingLimit

title: Post to Building
description: An application can create new building record or update existing records. If the Informer code does not exist in the database, the rest of the data sent in the POST request will be treated as a new entry. If the Informer code does exist in the database, the data sent in the POST request will replace the data in that record.

Success 200.description: Tells the application if the request was successful.
The action that was performed. This may be update or create.

examples.title: Success: Create
Success: Update
Curl
examples.content:
curl -H "X-Authorization: <Your-API-Key>" \
--data "campus=1" \
--data "name=Ackerman" \
--data "code=ACK" \
--url https://databridge.sage.edu/v1/building

examples.title: Ruby
examples.content:
# This code snippet uses an open-source library. http://unirest.io/ruby
response = Unirest.get "https://databridge.sage.edu/v1/building",
headers:{ "X-Authorization" => "<Your-API-Key>", "Accept" => "application/json" },
parameters:{ :campus => 1, :name => "Ackerman", :code => "ACK"}.to_json

examples.title: PHP
PowerShell
examples.content:
# PowerShell v3 and above
$headers = New-Object "System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary[[String],[String]]"
$headers.Add("X-Authorization", '<Your-API-Key>')
$uri = https://databridge.sage.edu/v1/building
$body = @{ campus = 1, name = "Ackerman", code = "ACK" }
$result = Invoke-RestMethod -Uri $uri -Headers $headers -Method Post -Body $body

examples.title: Java
examples.content:
# This code snippet uses an open-source library. http://unirest.io/java
HttpResponse <String> response = Unirest.get("https://databridge.sage.edu/v1/building")
.header("X-Authorization", "<Your-API-Key>")
.header("Accept", "application/json")
.body("{\"campus\":1, \"name\":\"Ackerman\", \"code\":\"ACK\"}")
.asString();

examples.title: Python
.NET
examples.content:
// This code snippet uses an open-source library http://unirest.io/net
 Task<HttpResponse<MyClass>> response = Unirest.post("https://databridge.sage.edu/v1/building")
 .header("X-Authorization", "<Your-API-Key>")
 .header("Accept", "application/json")
 .field("campus", 1)
 .field("name", "Ackerman")
 .field("code", "ACK")
 .asString();

Error 4xx/5xx.description: Tells the application if the request was successful.
An error message from the server.

Error: Invalid API Key
Error: Method not found
Error: Missing Header Option
Error: Server Error

Success 200.description: Tells the application if the request was successful.

The numeric id of the object.

The date and time that the object was created.
The date and time that the object was updated.

examples.title: Success: Objects
examples.content:
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
{
    "success": true,
    "result": [
      {
        "id": "1",
        "academic": "1",
        "code": "CEU",
        "name": "Continuing Education",
        "created_at": "2015-10-21 13:29:11",
        "updated_at": "2015-10-21 13:29:11"
      },
      {
         "id": "2",
         "academic": "1",
         "code": "HUM",
         "name": "Humanities",
         "created_at": "2015-10-21 13:29:11",
         "updated_at": "2015-10-21 13:29:11"
      },
      {
         "id": "3",
         "academic": "1",
         "code": "AMS",
         "name": "American Studies",
         "created_at": "2015-10-21 13:29:11",
         "updated_at": "2015-10-21 13:29:11"
      },
      {
         "id": "4",
         "academic": "1",
         "code": "AMS, ENG",
         "name": "American Studies, English",
         "created_at": "2015-10-21 13:29:11",
         "updated_at": "2015-10-21 13:29:11"
      }
    ]
}

name: GetDepartmentLimit

title: Post to Department
description: An application can create new department record or update existing records. If the Informer code does not exist in the database, the rest of the data sent in the POST request will be treated as a new entry. If the Informer code does exist in the database, the data sent in the POST request will replace the data in that record.

Parameter.description: Signifies if the department is an academic department.

Success 200.description: Tells the application if the request was successful.
The action that was performed. This may be update or create.

examples.title: Success: Create
Success: Update
Curl
examples.content:
curl -H "X-Authorization: <Your-API-Key>" \
--data "academic=true" \
--data "name=Humanities" \
--data "code=HUM" \
--url https://databridge.sage.edu/v1/department

examples.title: Ruby
examples.content:
# This code snippet uses an open-source library. http://unirest.io/ruby
response = Unirest.get "https://databridge.sage.edu/v1/department",
headers:{ "X-Authorization" => "<Your-API-Key>", "Accept" => "application/json" },
parameters:{ :academic => true, :name => "Humanities", :code => "HUM"}.to_json

examples.title: PHP
PowerShell
examples.content:
# PowerShell v3 and above
$headers = New-Object "System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary[[String],[String]]"
$headers.Add("X-Authorization", '<Your-API-Key>')
$uri = https://databridge.sage.edu/v1/department
$body = @{ academic = $true, name = "Humanities", code = "HUM" }
$result = Invoke-RestMethod -Uri $uri -Headers $headers -Method Post -Body $body

examples.title: Java
examples.content:
# This code snippet uses an open-source library. http://unirest.io/java
HttpResponse <String> response = Unirest.get("https://databridge.sage.edu/v1/department")
.header("X-Authorization", "<Your-API-Key>")
.header("Accept", "application/json")
.body("{\"academic\":true, \"name\":\"Humanities\", \"code\":\"HUM\"}")
.asString();

examples.title: Python
.NET
examples.content:
// This code snippet uses an open-source library http://unirest.io/net
 Task<HttpResponse<MyClass>> response = Unirest.post("https://databridge.sage.edu/v1/department")
 .header("X-Authorization", "<Your-API-Key>")
 .header("Accept", "application/json")
 .field("academic", true)
 .field("name", "Humanities")
 .field("code", "HUM")
 .asString();

Error 4xx/5xx.description: Tells the application if the request was successful.
An error message from the server.
